result.name: fca-whistleblowing-quarterly-data-2022-q3
result.notes:
The data shows the number of new whistleblowing reports the FCA received between July and September 2022 and the allegations they featured.

The FCA Whistleblowing team receives reports about alleged wrongdoing in the areas of financial services that fall within its remit.

The FCA assesses every whistleblowing case it receives, to inform the work it does and to help it to identify actual or potential harm that has arisen or could arise. This could be harm to consumers, to markets, to the UK economy or to wider society. 

The Whistleblowing team receives reports by telephone, email, its online reporting form and post. In 2022 Q3 (July - September), the FCA received 291 new whistleblowing reports.

organization.name: financial-conduct-authority
organization.title: Financial Conduct Authority (FCA)
organization.description: The Financial Conduct Authority is the conduct regulator for 59,000 financial services firms and financial markets in the UK and the prudential regulator for over 18,000 of those firms.

result.title: FCA: Whistleblowing quarterly data 2022 Q3
